description: Deploy a new environment. An Proton environment is created from an environment template that defines infrastructure and resources that can be shared across services. For more information, see Environments and Provisioning methods in the Proton User Guide.

parameters.name: codebuildRoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that allows Proton to provision infrastructure using CodeBuild-based provisioning on your behalf. To use CodeBuild-based provisioning for the environment or for any service instance running in the environment, specify either the environmentAccountConnectionId or codebuildRoleArn parameter.

parameters.name: componentRoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that Proton uses when provisioning directly defined components in this environment. It determines the scope of infrastructure that a component can provision. You must specify componentRoleArn to allow directly defined components to be associated with this environment. For more information about components, see Proton components in the Proton User Guide.

parameters.name: environmentAccountConnectionId
parameters.description: The ID of the environment account connection that you provide if you're provisioning your environment infrastructure resources to an environment account. For more information, see Environment account connections in the Proton User guide. To use Amazon Web Services-managed provisioning for the environment, specify either the environmentAccountConnectionId or protonServiceRoleArn parameter and omit the provisioningRepository parameter.

parameters.name: protonServiceRoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Proton service role that allows Proton to make calls to other services on your behalf. To use Amazon Web Services-managed provisioning for the environment, specify either the environmentAccountConnectionId or protonServiceRoleArn parameter and omit the provisioningRepository parameter.

parameters.name: provisioningRepository
parameters.description: The linked repository that you use to host your rendered infrastructure templates for self-managed provisioning. A linked repository is a repository that has been registered with Proton. For more information, see  CreateRepository. To use self-managed provisioning for the environment, specify this parameter and omit the environmentAccountConnectionId and protonServiceRoleArn parameters. The repository branch. The repository name. The repository provider.

parameters.name: spec
parameters.description: A YAML formatted string that provides inputs as defined in the environment template bundle schema file. For more information, see Environments in the Proton User Guide.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional list of metadata items that you can associate with the Proton environment. A tag is a key-value pair. For more information, see Proton resources and tagging in the Proton User Guide. (dict) --- A description of a resource tag. The key of the resource tag. The value of the resource tag.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: The key of the resource tag.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value of the resource tag.

parameters.name: templateMajorVersion
parameters.description: The major version of the environment template.

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: The name of the environment template. For more information, see Environment Templates in the Proton User Guide.

nested_items.name: environment
nested_items.description: The environment detail data that's returned by Proton.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment.

nested_items.name: codebuildRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that allows Proton to provision infrastructure using CodeBuild-based provisioning on your behalf.

nested_items.name: componentRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that Proton uses when provisioning directly defined components in this environment. It determines the scope of infrastructure that a component can provision.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time when the environment was created.

nested_items.name: deploymentStatus
nested_items.description: The environment deployment status.

nested_items.name: deploymentStatusMessage
nested_items.description: An environment deployment status message.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the environment.

nested_items.name: environmentAccountConnectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the environment account connection that's used to provision infrastructure resources in an environment account.

nested_items.name: environmentAccountId
nested_items.description: The ID of the environment account that the environment infrastructure resources are provisioned in.

nested_items.name: lastAttemptedDeploymentId
nested_items.description: The ID of the last attempted deployment of this environment.

nested_items.name: lastDeploymentAttemptedAt
nested_items.description: The time when a deployment of the environment was last attempted.

nested_items.name: lastDeploymentSucceededAt
nested_items.description: The time when the environment was last deployed successfully.

nested_items.name: lastSucceededDeploymentId
nested_items.description: The ID of the last successful deployment of this environment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the environment.

nested_items.name: protonServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Proton service role that allows Proton to make calls to other services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: provisioning
nested_items.description: When included, indicates that the environment template is for customer provisioned and managed infrastructure.

nested_items.name: provisioningRepository
nested_items.description: The linked repository that you use to host your rendered infrastructure templates for self-managed provisioning. A linked repository is a repository that has been registered with Proton. For more information, see CreateRepository.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the linked repository.

nested_items.name: branch
nested_items.description: The repository branch.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The repository name.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The repository provider.

nested_items.name: spec
nested_items.description: The environment spec.

nested_items.name: templateMajorVersion
nested_items.description: The major version of the environment template.

nested_items.name: templateMinorVersion
nested_items.description: The minor version of the environment template.

nested_items.name: templateName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment template.
